Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kristopher B. Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from Attorney Knueppel. RE: Requesting to be removed as the attorney of record from the list of attached cases

IT IS ORDERED that under the provisions of Chapter 973 of the Wisconsin Statutes. the following action is hereby taken: Mr Butler shall be incarcerated in the Rock County Jail, as a condition of probation, for a period of 45 days beginning the date this order is signed, without HUBER privileges.
Court appointed attorney's fees paid by accounting.  Defendant is ordered to reimburse Rock County for payment of attorney fees.

Defendant Kristopher Brice Butler in court with attorney Shanna Knueppel.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. No contest plea to counts 2 and 3. Guilty plea to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty on counts 2 and 3. Court withholds findings of guilt on count 1 hold open agreement filed. Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 years probation. Court orders restitution surcharges. DOC to collect. 0 days credit.
